post.excerpt: Sweet and fruity coffee which I drank during a busy month so I didn't play with it that much. I remember it being nice and consistent, though, which counts!

content.value: I brought home for my family, I needed something more fruity and sweet, more to my liking. And to stick with my recently-discovered new favorite coffee place, the
, that's where I went after returning to Vienna. After a discussion with the baristas, they recommended a new roast,
, which I believe should be a slightly different roasting entity than the RÃ¶sthaus itself - or at least it is branded as such.

/5, body 3/5, and acidity 2/5, with flavour notes of peach, jasmine and vanilla. It comes from the Odo Shakiso District in Ethiopia, with a mixed heirloom variety from between 1800 and 2000 MASL. The cherries were dried in the sun for 15 to 20 says before being freed from the pulp
I have to admit, I had this coffee during a busy university period, so I didn't even note down anything. I remember it being very consistent and good, so I guess it did its job!
